translation.en: [Ilyasah] No matter which way you turn, there is destiny.
translation.ko: 어떤 방향으로 가든 운명과 맞닥뜨려요 "봉사는 천국의 임대료다"

translation.en: It was destiny that my father and Cassius Clay would meet.
translation.ko: 아버지와 캐시어스 클레이가 만난 것도 운명이었죠

translation.en: Three short years that they would spend in their lives,
translation.ko: 3년이라는 짧은 시간 동안 "일리야사 샤바즈 맬컴 엑스의 딸"

translation.en: that destiny created for them…
that was their blood brotherhood.
We are no longer slaves. White people no longer own us.
translation.ko: 우린 이제 노예가 아닙니다 백인들 소유가 아니죠

translation.en: Cassius destroyed that image the other night
when he knocked out Sonny Liston.
[Howard Cosell] The heavyweight champion is Cassius Clay!
[Ilyasah] Malcolm came to this young man
and he gave him the power that he needed
to speak.
[Rahman] Malcolm and Muhammad.
They were very close…
…literally as brothers.
And I was there to witness it.
[documentary interviewer] Did your brother like being around Malcolm?
Loved, loved, loved being around him. I did too.
He had that air about him.
It was divine.
The electricity that came from his body was sacred.
Only a few people like that in the world.
translation.ko: 세상에 그런 사람은 몇 안 되죠

translation.en: [documentary interviewer] Why do you think they stopped being friends?
[Rahman] Well…
"Destiny can take your best friend as an instrument to cause you harm
translation.ko: 운명은 절친한 친구를 이용해 해를 끼치기도 합니다

translation.en: and your worst enemy to do you good."
translation.ko: 최악의 적을 이용해 선을 이루기도 하죠

translation.en: Right?
Judas betrayed Jesus.
Malcolm X betrayed Elijah Muhammad.
"Destiny can take your best friend as an instrument to do you harm
translation.ko: 운명은 절친한 친구를 이용해 해를 끼치기도 합니다

translation.en: and your worst enemy to do you good."
translation.ko: 최악의 적을 이용해 선을 이루기도 하죠

translation.en: [Malcolm] It is time for you and me to stand up for ourselves.
translation.ko: 이제 우리 자신을 위해 나설 때가 됐습니다

translation.en: It is time for you and me to see for ourselves.
translation.ko: 우리 자신을 위해 판단할 때가 됐습니다

translation.en: And it is time for you and me to fight for ourselves.
translation.ko: 우리 자신을 위해 싸울 때가 됐습니다

translation.en: [Dr. West] You unloved.
That's what it is to be Black in a white-supremacist world.
translation.ko: 백인 지상주의 세계에서 흑인의 삶이 그렇죠

translation.en: You are unloved, uncared for, untended to,
and viewed less beautiful, less moral, less intelligent,
translation.ko: 아름답고 도덕적이고 똑똑한 존재가 못 되죠

translation.en: and you are told to always be scared.
Malcolm X, Muhammad Ali…
no way.
Malcolm X and Muhammad Ali
were the two most freest of Black men in the 20th century.
On the other hand, you know, there's a--
There's a cross to bear.
There's a tremendous cost to being a free and loving person.
translation.ko: 자유롭고 자애로운 사람이 되려면 대가가 따르거든요

translation.en: [Muhammad] …twenty-two years old. I must be the greatest!
-I am the king of the world! -[reporter] Hold it.
-I'm pretty! -[reporter] Not that pretty.
[Muhammad] I'm a bad man!
-[reporter] Wait-- -[Muhammad] I shook up the world!
I shook up the world!
It was unusual for a Black person
to think of themself as quote, "pretty."
[Muhammad] Champ of the world should be pretty like me.
I'm the king of the ring!
[Dr. Boyd] Athletes were expected to be humble.
And then you had the Louisville Lip.
Tenacity and dignity and, like, pride,
and, "So what you don't like me? So what?"
What do I act like I am to you?
-A bad fella? -[interviewer] I don't know.
You're just-- Like you say, you're the greatest.
And a lot of people, even a lot of Black people,
weren't comfortable with this. They called him a loudmouth.
translation.ko: 그런 행동을 불편해했죠 입만 살았다고 했어요

translation.en: I don't have to be what you want me to be.
translation.ko: 난 남들이 원하는 대로 살 필요 없어요

translation.en: It was a moment of transition,
and Ali really is at the forefront of this transition, as is Malcolm.
I'm free to be what I wanna be and think what I wanna think.
translation.ko: 난 자유롭게 원하는 대로 살고 생각하고 싶은 대로 생각해요

translation.en: [interviewer] That's right.
[Dr. Boyd] They're changing the way the world saw… the Black man.
translation.ko: 두 사람은 흑인을 바라보는 세상의 시선을 바꿔요

translation.en: How could so few white people
rule so many Black people?
Martin Luther King, whose school of thought I come out of,
translation.ko: 전 마틴 루서 킹의 가르침에 영향을 받았는데

translation.en: spoke to who we must become.
translation.ko: 마틴 루서 킹은 우리의 미래를 말씀하셨죠

translation.en: Malcolm spoke to who we were
translation.ko: 맬컴이 얘기한 건 과거의 우리 모습과

translation.en: and who put us there.
These homegrown Negro American Muslims
are the most powerful of the Black-supremacist groups.
translation.ko: 흑인 우월주의 단체 중에 가장 강력합니다

translation.en: Mike Wallace had, of course, done this television program about the Nation
translation.ko: 마이크 월리스가 네이션 오브 이슬람을 주제로

translation.en: called The Hate That Hate Produced.
translation.ko: 마이크 월리스가 네이션 오브 이슬람을 주제로 '증오가 낳은 증오'라는 TV 쇼를 진행했어요

translation.en: Four or five times a year, the Muslims assemble
in one of America's major cities
to hear their leader Elijah Muhammad,
founder and spiritual leader of the group.
The Christian religion has failed you.
But of even more interest to New Yorkers is Malcolm X,
translation.ko: 뉴욕 시민이 더 주목하는 사람은 맬컴 엑스입니다

translation.en: the Muslims' New York minister.
The Black man by nature is divine.
[interviewer] Now, does this mean that the white man by nature is evil?
By nature, he is other than divine.
This critique of whiteness was very powerful,
because prior to this time,
you had to say something like that in private.
You certainly couldn't call white people devils.
Not out loud.
By nature, he is evil.
[Mike Wallace] He's a remarkable man, a man who, by his own admission,
was once a procurer and dope peddler.
But now he's a changed man. He will not smoke or drink.
His life changed for him when the Muslim faith
taught him no longer to be ashamed of being a Black man.
translation.ko: 흑인인 걸 부끄러워하지 말라고 가르쳐 줬죠

translation.en: [Herb] You know, you have what you call a reference point.
Malcolm's father was a solid reference. Of course his mother too.
Earl, his father, and Louise, his mother,
were followers of the Marcus Garvey movement.
[Dr. Garvey] My father's organization sought
to link Africans,
in Africa, in the Caribbean, in the United States.
My father felt that instead of Africans being servile,
they must become self-reliant.
[Dr. West] There is no Malcolm X without Garvey.
Garvey used to say,
"The Negro… is not afraid."
[Herb] There's no more significant influence you could have
for a young Black boy,
is to be in the company of a father who is so well-versed
and had the-- An audience in his hand,
you know, as both a minister, a preacher,
and a representative of the whole Garvey movement.
[man] Malcolm's father was Malcolm's hero.
But the problem was there were white supremacists
who wanted to silence Earl Little.
[Dr. Smith] Malcolm's just six years of age
when his father is killed in 1931.
[Ilyasah] It was horrific, what they did to him.
He was knocked over the head,
dragged to the trolley track
so that the oncoming train would roll over him.
[Herb] For the first five or six years of his life,
he had a kind of a first-hand opportunity
to capture the majesty of his father's voice.
Over the years, he would certainly return to those moments
of the whole Garvey movement.
Out of the organization came people like Elijah Muhammad,
translation.ko: 가비 운동에 참여했던 일라이자 무하마드 같은 사람들이

translation.en: who went on to form the Nation of Islam.
Elijah Muhammad took what he had learned:
translation.ko: 일라이자 무하마드는 자신이 배운 걸 활용했어요

translation.en: the concept of having an economic base,
the discipline, and the militaristic attire,
and put it in the religious setting of the Black Muslims.
[reporter] Long before the age of 21,
Malcolm X ran away from school and went to Harlem.
translation.ko: 맬컴 엑스는 학교를 떠나 할렘으로 갔습니다

translation.en: And there, he ran numbers, sold bootleg whiskey,
translation.ko: 거기서 도박장을 운영하고 불법 위스키를 팔고

translation.en: procured business for prostitutes, used and pushed dope.
In the late '40s, Malcolm X pulled a robbery in Boston,
translation.ko: 1940년대 후반, 맬컴 엑스는 보스턴에서 강도 행각을 벌였고

translation.en: was caught, and sent to prison.
[Mike Wallace] He served time for robbery
in the Michigan and Massachusetts state penitentiary.
[Dr. West] Early on, he had a kind of inquisitiveness.
You know, like most restless folk,
translation.ko: 가만히 못 있는 사람이 많이들 그러듯이

translation.en: you can end up expressing it in a gangster-like way.
You're trying to conquer, be in control.
[Herb] Inside the prison walls, he's like a caged tiger,
absorbing information,
cultivating his intelligence, reading.
That's his indoctrination. That's the beginning.
So once he's out in 1952,
he goes back to Michigan,
and he really involves himself in the Nation.
I'm real happy and thankful to Allah
for the energy and for the spirit
that he has put in Minister Malcolm.
[Herb] And so much so, by 1954…
he's the national spokesperson.
My name is Rahman Ali.
I'm proud and happy to say I'm the only brother of Muhammad Ali.
He's gone to paradise. The next time I see my brother will be in heaven,
translation.ko: 형은 천국에 갔어요 다음에 형을 보면 천국일 거예요

translation.en: and we'll be in heaven together.
As small children growing up, he always told me,
"I'm gonna be the most famous man in the whole world."
translation.ko: '난 세상에서 가장 유명한 남자가 될 거야'

translation.en: As a small child, 10, 11, 12, 13…
He did exactly what he said he would do.
[Bob] The pink house right there is Muhammad Ali.
translation.ko: 저 분홍색 집이 무하마드 알리의 집이에요

translation.en: Cassius Clay, but we called him GG.
translation.ko: 본명은 캐시어스 클레이인데 우린 GG라고 불렀죠

translation.en: We all went to the same elementary school,
junior high school, and senior high school.
Central High School's the only Black school in the city of Louisville.
translation.ko: 센트럴 고등학교는 루이빌에서 유일한 흑인 학교예요

translation.en: We didn't have none of the major amenities the white schools had.
translation.ko: 우리한텐 백인들 학교에 있는 편의 시설이 없었어요

translation.en: They didn't put a track and football field at Central High School
translation.ko: 학교를 통합하고 나서야 경주로와 풋볼 경기장을

translation.en: until they integrated the school.
[Gene] Cassius Clay Sr. was Southern Baptist,
Cassius Clay Jr. was Southern Baptist, and they went to the church.
translation.ko: 캐시어스 클레이 주니어도 남부 침례교도라 교회에 다녔죠

translation.en: He told me one time he went down to Louisville,
translation.ko: 한번은 루이빌에 갔을 때 얘기를 해 줬어요

translation.en: he went outside a little church.
They were singing the same hymns that they were singing in his church.
translation.ko: 자기 교회에서 부르는 것과 같은 찬송이 들렸대요

translation.en: "What a Friend We Have in Jesus."
And out comes the minister, said, "Hey, boy, get out of here."
translation.ko: 그런데 목사가 오더니 교회에서 나가라고 했대요

translation.en: He said, "Something's wrong."
"They're singing the same hymns we are."
"Now, why do I have to leave 'cause I'm Black?"
[Bob] Segregation was outrageous.
You went to the bus station, it said "Colored section."
translation.ko: 버스 정거장에 유색 인종 구역이 있었죠 "유색 인종 대기실"

translation.en: You knew at the department stores you couldn't try on clothes.
They'll take your money, but you gotta buy that suit and hope it fits.
translation.ko: 돈은 받으면서 입어 보지도 않고 사래요

translation.en: You ain't gonna put it on.
Cassius Clay was born in 1942.
[Randy] Emmett Till was born in 1941.
[reporter] Money, Mississippi,
a story that shocked the entire United States.
translation.ko: 미국 전역을 충격에 빠트린 사건이 일어납니다 "미시시피, 1955년"

translation.en: [Randy] The Emmett Till story
was a searing event
to the man who's going to become Muhammad Ali.
[reporter 2] Emmett Till, 14, was kidnapped and killed
allegedly for wolf whistling at the wife of accused, Roy Bryant.
translation.ko: 피고인 로이 브라이언트의 아내에게 추근댄 게 이유라죠

translation.en: Bryant and his half-brother J.W. Milam, were acquitted by this jury.
[Dr. Smith] He looked at Emmett Till's mutilated face in the pages of Jet magazine.
translation.ko: 캐시어스는 '제트'지에서 에밋 틸의 훼손된 얼굴을 봤어요

translation.en: He's heard the horrific stories from his father about the lynchings
translation.ko: 아버지한테 폭행에 관한 끔찍한 얘기를 들었고요

translation.en: that continue to happen.
My father was always very sensitive to oppression.
And his father taught him, like any other Black man would do today,
how to survive.
And my grandmother would say,
"This really bothered your father."
He wanted to be great,
but this is a darkness for a child.
[Shabazz-Allah] I met Malcolm in Temple No. 7 Restaurant.
translation.ko: 넘버 세븐 템플 레스토랑에서 맬컴을 만났어요

translation.en: When Malcolm came in, boy, he-- A giant.
Malcolm, a giant.
I shook his hand.
The power of his hand, it felt like God.
[Herb] I first met Malcolm in person
in about 1959, 1960.
He walked down the hallway and shake everybody's hand.
My cousin would say, "Go ahead and ask him a question."
I'd say, "No, no, no." I was so terrified. [chuckles]
[Shabazz-Allah] On Sunday, at Temple No. 7,
Malcolm taught
two, three, four, sometimes five hours nonstop.
The man that kidnapped us and brought us here.
[crowd] Yeah.
-Who made a slave out of us. -[crowd] Yeah.
-Who hung us on trees. -[crowd] Right on.
-I don't have to tell you which man. -[crowd] That's right.
translation.ko: - 누구인지 말 안 해도 알겠죠? - 네

translation.en: [A. Peter] I had never heard anyone talk about attacks on the mind
with the clarity that he did.
Movies and school textbooks,
the television programs,
translation.ko: "피터 베일리 교수, 기자, 작가" TV 프로그램

translation.en: all of this was constant psychological attacks.
Even calls us "boy."
Don't care how big you get, he calls you "boy."
Malcolm made you believe you couldn't die.
And when you're a young man and you get a teaching like that,
that's what you need.
[reporter] Rome welcomes the Summer Games of the XVII Olympiad.
[Randy] In 1960, Cassius Clay is 18 years old.
He's young, he's wide-eyed,
goes to the Rome Olympics.
[reporter] Cassius Clay the winner for the USA.
And even then, he had that jaw-dropping charisma.
He becomes virtually the mayor of the Olympic Village.
First time I really saw him up close,
he's sitting on the steps in the Olympic Village…
and he's raving. He's got the medal,
translation.ko: 소리치고 있었어요 자기가 받은 메달을 높이 쳐들고요

translation.en: and he's holding it up. "Look at me. Look who I am, how pretty I--"
translation.ko: 자기가 받은 메달을 높이 쳐들고요 '나 좀 봐 내가 얼마나 예쁜지 봐'

translation.en: "I'm gonna be the heavyweight champion of the world."
They don't understand a freaking word he's saying.
But I noticed something.
Every time the athlete was a woman,
they stopped and turned and looked back at him.
I said, "This is a guy that's gonna have something."
"I don't know what, but it's gonna be something."
Tell me how you came to get such a Roman name as that.
Well, as I understand, I'm Cassius Marcellus Clay VI,
and my great-great-grandfather was a Kentucky slave,
translation.ko: 전 캐시어스 마셀러스 클레이 6세고 제 고조부는 켄터키 노예였는데

translation.en: and he was named after some great Kentuckian.
translation.ko: 어떤 위대한 켄터키 사람의 이름으로 불렸어요

translation.en: Where he was from,
or where it was all originated, I couldn't tell you,
but since I've reached a little fame in boxing,
most people want to know where am I from
and where did I get that name, but I haven't really checked on it.
translation.ko: 이름의 유래를 궁금해하는데 정확하게 확인 안 해 봤어요

translation.en: He could not be more proud to represent America.
translation.ko: 캐시어스는 미국을 대표하는 걸 아주 자랑스러워했어요

translation.en: This was his greatest honor.
And one of the things that he recognizes there,
is that there's no Jim Crow signs.
translation.ko: 흑인 분리 정책이 없다는 걸 깨달아요

translation.en: He enjoys a freedom of movement he's never experienced before.
translation.ko: 전에 경험하지 못한 이동의 자유를 즐기죠

translation.en: This is not like Louisville, Kentucky.
[Elijah] I represent to you,
not a puppet.
[man in crowd] Yes, sir.
But I represent to you God in person.
-In person. -[crowd] Yes, sir!
[crowd cheering] That's right!
[Shabazz-Allah] In the most holy name of Almighty God, Allah…
the true and living God, the only God…
we forever thank him for his divine Messenger,
and only Messenger, the Most Honorable Elijah Muhammad.
Why do you have any faith in white people?
-[crowd] That's right. -Tell me that.
The Messenger's program is a discipline
translation.ko: 신의 사자의 가르침은 우리 모두가 필요로 하지만 경험하지 못한 규율이었어요

translation.en: that we all need and never had.
translation.ko: 우리 모두가 필요로 하지만 경험하지 못한 규율이었어요

translation.en: No alcohol,
no drugs, no tobacco,
no pork.
Neat, clean, organized.
I'm Melchisedek Supreme Shabazz-Allah,
known as the universal high priest of the Nation of Islam
on Earth and in the universe.
I'm 84 years old.
Very peaceful man. You understand what I'm trying to say?
But it's nothing for me to take your lights out.
translation.ko: 한 방 먹이는 건 일도 아니죠

translation.en: 'Cause you're trained that way.
Very peaceful, very respectful, never the aggressor,
translation.ko: 폭력을 쓰지 말고 존중해 주고 공격해선 안 돼요

translation.en: but deadly.
The brother who you think is humble, meek and ins-- And insecure,
that brother is cold as ice when it comes to the teachings.
translation.ko: 가르침을 전할 때는 얼마나 냉혹한지 몰라요

translation.en: You say we hate white people.
We don't hate anybody.
We love our own people so much,
they think we hate the ones who are inflicting injustice against them.
translation.ko: 우리를 부당하게 대하는 사람들을 싫어하는 것처럼 보일 뿐이죠

translation.en: [radio host] This is WHAS in Louisville, Kentucky,
and our guest tonight, Louisville's Cassius Clay,
translation.ko: 오늘 밤 게스트인 루이빌의 캐시어스 클레이는

translation.en: the fourth-ranked world heavyweight. Hello.
[radio caller] Do you think that you are as good a boxer as Joe Louis was?
translation.ko: 당신이 조 루이스만큼 훌륭한 복서라고 생각하세요?

translation.en: [Muhammad, on radio] I'm not as good, but better.
I'm more classier, I'm faster, and I talk more.
[Randy] Who wins the gold medal at the Rome Olympics.
He's a hero.
But when he gets back to Louisville, he finds Louisville's the same.
I just got in from Rome, and I wanna turn professional.
translation.ko: 전 방금 로마에서 돌아왔고 프로로 뛰고 싶어요

translation.en: [Dr. Smith] The standard understanding
is that Black athletes will be deferential on civil rights.
They will be seen and not heard.
[Bob] He wins the Olympics, and he's also overseas
translation.ko: 올림픽에서 우승도 하고 해외에서는 차별이 없다는 것도 알게 돼요

translation.en: where things aren't segregated.
translation.ko: 해외에서는 차별이 없다는 것도 알게 돼요

translation.en: He comes back home thinking being the champion
would change things, but it didn't.
[Dr. Smith] Cassius Clay goes into a diner.
A white man at the counter says, "We don't serve your kind, boy."
translation.ko: 카운터에 있는 백인 남자가 흑인한텐 음식 안 판다고 해요

translation.en: And there he is with his Olympic jacket and his gold medal.
He's humiliated.
In that moment, he rejects America.
He rips the medal off,
tosses it into the river.
That disappointment, thinking, "Okay, I've done this for America,
I'm the champ, I'm everything, but I'm still in a segregated world,"
translation.ko: 바뀌는 건 없다는 사실에 캐시어스는 실망했어요

translation.en: I think it got him. That woke us all up, to tell the truth.
translation.ko: 생각이 바뀐 거예요 솔직히 우리 모두 정신이 들었죠

translation.en: I'm Gordon B. Davidson, attorney for the Louisville Sponsoring Group,
translation.ko: 저는 고든 B. 데이비드슨입니다 캐시어스 클레이를 소유한 루이빌 후원 단체 변호사이자

translation.en: owner of Cassius Clay,
translation.ko: 캐시어스 클레이를 소유한 루이빌 후원 단체 변호사이자

translation.en: and the hired hand to keep the group and Cassius Clay together.
translation.ko: 캐시어스 클레이를 단체의 관리 아래 두려 고용된 사람이죠

translation.en: [Randy] He's now of interest to certain white residents of Louisville,
translation.ko: 몇몇 루이빌 백인 주민들이 캐시어스한테 관심을 가져요

translation.en: who view him as a commodity.
Okay? Something that can be marketed.
I'm W.L. Lyons Brown,
chairman of the board of Brown-Forman Distillers Corporation.
[Randy] A group of very wealthy businessmen
formed the Louisville Sponsoring Group
to manage his boxing career.
J.D. Stetson Coleman.
I'm Worth Bingham, assistant publisher…
[Robert] And he's controlled
by these 11 rich Louisville guys.
I'm one of the founders of the group of Cassius Clay.
[Robert] And talking to them, you would kind of have a sense
translation.ko: 그 사람들과 캐시어스 얘기를 하다 보면

translation.en: that they were talking about one of their racehorses.
"He was a really good boy."
[Randy] Cassius goes to Miami
to train under Angelo Dundee,
one of the best trainers in the business.
And then he met a man by the name of Abdul Rahman,
"Captain Sam."
[Wali] My father was the captain of the Miami mosque.
translation.ko: 제 아버지 샘은 마이애미 모스크의 지도자였어요 "무하마드 왈리"

translation.en: This was the area of the mosque at that particular time.
He's out pushing the Muhammad Speaks newspaper.
He hears a guy from across the street yell out,
"Why are we called Negroes?"
"Why are we deaf, dumb and blind?"
translation.ko: '우리는 왜 귀먹고 벙어리고 장님이죠?' "네이션 오브 이슬람"

translation.en: "Why is everybody making progress, and we're so far behind?"
My dad said, "Hey, man, I see you hip to the teachings."
"Yeah, man. I'm Cassius Clay."
Right away, they had an automatic chemistry.
[Randy] There's no sense for most of America
that Cassius Clay has a secret.
That he's leading a double life.
[Dr. Smith] In 1959, Cassius Clay is in Chicago for an amateur boxing exhibition.
translation.ko: 1959년, 아마추어 복싱 대회로 캐시어스는 시카고에 있어요

translation.en: He had free time, he's out on the street,
and he sees members of the Nation of Islam.
And one of them hands him a record.
"A White Man's Heaven…"
[Dr. Boyd] "…Is a Black Man's Hell"
by Louis X, eventually known as Louis Farrakhan,
translation.ko: 루이스 엑스가 불렀는데 나중에 루이스 패러칸으로 밝혀지죠

translation.en: at one time known as Calypso Gene the Charmer.
[Louis Farrakhan singing] ♪ Before we came to America ♪ ♪ We were living in the East ♪
[Dr. Smith] So Cassius takes this record back to Louisville,
and he plays it over and over and over again.
[Jerry] When he was training at the 5th St. Gym in Miami,
I saw some changing faces in the camp.
Sam Saxon, Captain Sam, is with him.
translation.ko: 샘 색슨, 즉 캡틴 샘도 함께 있죠

translation.en: And as far as Angelo Dundee knows,
he's a boyhood pal who he lets hang around the gym.
translation.ko: 그저 캐시어스의 유년 시절 친구인 줄 알아요

translation.en: I just got through with the Henry Cooper fight.
[Wali] Every day, they would get together.
He would teach Cassius Clay about Islam, and, you know, bring the teachings to him.
translation.ko: 아버지는 캐시어스 클레이한테 이슬람교를 가르치고 가르침을 전하곤 했어요

translation.en: [Zaheer] The Nation of Islam began to provide Clay
a whole language of Black excellence
and Black supreme achievement.
[Randy] Captain Sam starts to mentor Cassius Clay…
translation.ko: 캡틴 샘이 캐시어스 클레이의 멘토가 되어 줘요

translation.en: That is what I'm teaching.
[Randy] …in the career of the Honorable Elijah Muhammad…
And these Negro leaders…
[Randy] …in the emerging supernova of Malcolm X.
translation.ko: 맬컴 엑스라는 떠오르는 신성도 알려 주죠

translation.en: Cassius becomes closer to the Nation of Islam.
He doesn't join the Nation,
but he's interested.
[documentary interviewer] You think your brother could've become the greatest without his faith?
translation.ko: 형이 믿음 없이 최고가 될 수 있었을까요?

translation.en: No, sir.
The faith of Islam gave-- Gave-- Gave-- Gave us confidence.
G-- God-- Oh, my God is decent,
God is powerful, God is ri-- Righteous.
Elijah Muhammad, Malcolm X gave us confidence to be great.
translation.ko: 일라이자 무하마드와 맬컴 엑스는 위대해질 수 있다는 믿음을 줬어요

translation.en: [Randy] In June, Cassius and his brother, they were in their home in Louisville,
and they got a call from Captain Sam.
The Nation of Islam was holding a big rally in Detroit.
translation.ko: 네이션 오브 이슬람이 디트로이트에서 집회를 연다고요

translation.en: Cassius and Rudy could not be more excited.
They've never seen the Messenger in person.
translation.ko: 신의 사자를 직접 본 적이 없었거든요

translation.en: Captain Sam drives from Miami to Louisville,
picks up the Clay brothers, and they go to Detroit.
translation.ko: 클레이 형제를 데리러 와서 디트로이트로 향해요

translation.en: But before they go into Olympia Stadium, Sam takes them into a diner,
translation.ko: 올림픽 경기장에 가기 전에 샘이 식당으로 데려가죠

translation.en: and in that diner is Malcolm X.
[Randy] There's Malcolm X, sitting at a table
like he would always sit at a table, facing the door.
You know, almost like kind of an Old West cowboy movie.
Around Malcolm's table are guards.
Cassius is starstruck.
Rarely is Cassius starstruck.
[Ilyasah] "He acted as if I was supposed to know who he was."
"I had never even heard of him."
"Ours were two entirely different worlds."
"In fact, Elijah Muhammad instructed us Muslims
against all forms of sports."
That's funny. My father didn't know who he was,
but he just went along with, you know, that sense of importance.
translation.ko: 중요한 사람처럼 행동하니까 장단 맞춰 주셨어요

translation.en: "If this man thinks he is famous,
then I'm gonna go along with him."
"Of course I know you, you're great." [laughs]
[Rahman] Malcolm X was a genius.
He spoke the truth about how Black folks were mistreated in America.
It wasn't hate, it was truth.
[Dr. Smith] Rudy and Cassius, they go into Olympia Stadium.
translation.ko: "알라 외에 다른 신은 없다 무하마드는 알라의 사도" 루디와 캐시어스는 올림픽 경기장에 가요

translation.en: And what do they see?
They see an army of Black men.
Proud Black men,
dressed in black suits, bow ties,
and there's a sense of order, there's a sense of discipline.
[Elijah] Before the white man, we had great civilizations
translation.ko: 백인이 오기 전에 우린 위대한 문명이 있었습니다

translation.en: just as powerful than what the white man has put on the Earth.
And the message that Cassius hears that day is separation or death.
translation.ko: 그날 캐시어스가 들었던 메시지는 '분리 아니면 죽음'이에요

translation.en: -[Elijah] Separation or death. -[crowd applauds, cheers]
[Elijah] We don't want no integration. We want separation.
translation.ko: 우린 통합을 원치 않습니다 분리를 원합니다

translation.en: [Elijah] We don't nothing but the freedom
to own some of this Earth that we can call our own.
translation.ko: 이 땅에서 무언가를 우리 것이라고 부를 수 있는 자유죠

translation.en: This analysis of the white man being the devil
was really attractive to people
who had experienced hell at the hands of white people.
And what good is Christianity to you and I
if the religion will not defend us against lynchers?
translation.ko: 종교가 폭행범들 손에서 우리를 지켜 주지 않는데요

translation.en: [crowd] Right.
They say they are followers of Jesus.
They're followers of the devil.
[Ilyasah] "Now and then, I heard how Cassius
showed up in Muslim mosques and restaurants in various cities."
"And if I happened to be speaking anywhere within reasonable distance
translation.ko: '내가 캐시어스가 있는 곳에서 그리 멀지 않은 곳에서'

translation.en: of wherever Cassius was, he would be present."
[Dr. Smith] In March of 1963,
Cassius is in New York for the fight against Doug Jones.
translation.ko: 캐시어스는 더그 존스와의 경기로 뉴욕에 와요 "캐시어스 클레이 대 더그 존스"

translation.en: [Dr. Smith] Who's there?
Malcolm has taken a special interest in this young heavyweight.
translation.ko: 맬컴은 이 젊은 헤비급 선수한테 특별한 관심을 보였어요

translation.en: [boxing commentator] Clay, winner by unanimous decision.
[Dr. Smith] The next day, Cassius Clay is seen out in public
wearing the dark suit, the white shirt, the black bow tie.
translation.ko: 흰 셔츠에 검은 정장을 입고 검은 나비넥타이를 맸죠

translation.en: Then he gives an interview to the New York Post.
He was asked about why he didn't join civil rights marches.
translation.ko: 기자가 시민권 행진에 참여하지 않는 이유를 물어봤더니

translation.en: He says that, "I don't believe in non-violence."
And that, "I believe in an eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth."
translation.ko: 눈에는 눈, 이에는 이를 믿는다고 해요

translation.en: It's very clear what happened.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 있었는지 확실히 알 수 있어요

translation.en: He's in Harlem.
He was spending time with Malcolm.
Malcolm brought Muhammad Ali to the temple and introduced Muhammad Ali to us.
translation.ko: 맬컴이 무하마드 알리를 모스크에 데려와서 소개해 줬어요

translation.en: They had this kind of student-teacher relationship.
[Herb] Their age difference…
22-year-old Adonis,
and here's-- Here's Malcolm coming in, a little bit older.
An understanding of the world
that's gonna be important to-- To Muhammad Ali.
You can't be around Malcolm and not learn.
translation.ko: 맬컴 곁에 있으면서 안 배울 수가 없어요

translation.en: Malcolm shared the wisdom.
[Malcolm] If the government can't defend us, what should we do?
translation.ko: 정부가 우리를 보호할 수 없다면 어떡해야 하죠?

translation.en: Go find out who bombed the church
translation.ko: 앨라배마주 버밍엄에서 교회를 폭파한 범인을 알아내야죠

translation.en: in Birmingham, Alabama.
translation.ko: 앨라배마주 버밍엄에서 교회를 폭파한 범인을 알아내야죠 "폭격으로 어린이 4명 사망"

translation.en: If they can't find out, then let us go find out.
And when we find--
-[crowd applauds] -I don't wanna hear that.
And when we find out who it was
who murdered our little female babies,
then the law of justice is that a murderer should be murdered.
When Cassius Clay meets Malcolm X,
translation.ko: 캐시어스 클레이는 맬컴 엑스를 만났을 때

translation.en: he has no idea Malcolm is moving in a new political direction.
translation.ko: 맬컴이 새로운 정치적 방향으로 나아간다는 걸 몰랐어요

translation.en: Malcolm believes the Nation of Islam has the potential
translation.ko: 맬컴은 네이션 오브 이슬람이 잠재력이 있으며

translation.en: to make a much bigger difference if it joins the front lines.
translation.ko: 최전선에 진출하면 큰 변화를 이끌 거로 생각하죠

translation.en: Don't you be fooled by these Uncle Tom Negro preachers.
translation.ko: 백인 종노릇 하는 설교자들한테 속지 마세요

translation.en: When a dog attacks you, you get that dog,
translation.ko: 개가 여러분을 공격하면 개를 잡아야 합니다

translation.en: two-legged dog or four-legged dog.
translation.ko: 두 다리 달린 개든 네 다리 달린 개든요

translation.en: He did not advocate violence, he advocated self-defense.
translation.ko: 폭력을 옹호한 게 아니라 정당방위를 옹호한 거예요

translation.en: [Dr. Boyd] We're not trying to start anything. Don't start no shit,
translation.ko: 우린 뭘 시작하려는 게 아니에요 문제를 일으키지 않으면 아무 일도 없죠

translation.en: won't be none started.
translation.ko: 문제를 일으키지 않으면 아무 일도 없죠

translation.en: But if you come for us, be prepared to fight,
because we're not embracing this Martin Luther King philosophy.
translation.ko: 우린 마틴 루서 킹의 철학을 잇지 않거든요

translation.en: [Dr. Smith] But Elijah has told him to stand down.
In a number of Elijah's letters to Malcolm, he reminds him,
translation.ko: 일라이자가 맬컴한테 보낸 수많은 편지에 계속 나오죠

translation.en: "Do not say anything that you have not heard me say."
translation.ko: 자신이 하지 않은 말을 하지 말라고요

translation.en: Elijah said,
"The judgment of white America will come at the hands of God."
translation.ko: '백인 미국의 심판은 신의 손으로 이루어질 겁니다'

translation.en: For Malcolm, this did not align
translation.ko: 이건 정의를 더 빨리 이룩하고 싶었던

translation.en: with his desire to see justice more immediately.
[Malcolm] As long as this so-called civil rights struggle is led--
translation.ko: 소위 시민권 투쟁을 계속 주도하는 한...

translation.en: And when I say "led," I use "led" in quotes.
Actually contained by Uncle Tom Negro leaders,
translation.ko: 실은 백인 종노릇하는 지도자들이 억제하는 한

translation.en: then the white power structure isn't worried at all.
They only worry when they know that the masses of Black people
translation.ko: 수많은 흑인이 폭발할 준비가 됐다는 걸 알아야

translation.en: are ready to explode.
And in exploding,
it will destroy some of the furniture in their house.
translation.ko: 백인들 집에 있는 가구를 부숴 버릴 거예요

translation.en: [Maryum] My father loved his fearlessness.
And he did pattern a lot of his presentation
based on how Malcolm presented himself.
You start to see some of the early developing tension
translation.ko: 긴장감이 쌓이기 시작하는 게 슬슬 보이기 시작해요

translation.en: between the Honorable Elijah Muhammad and Malcolm X.
Elijah Muhammad was not charismatic
in the way that Malcolm was charismatic.
Because you don't like the idea
of white people shooting Black people down, do you?
And you're ready to do something about it, aren't you?
-[crowd cheers] -We know you are.
[Zaheer] The rank and file of the Nation of Islam loved Malcolm.
For many people,
he was their most direct experience and encounter
with the teachings of Elijah Muhammad.
[Dr. Boyd] Once Malcolm began to pursue things like an intellectual,
I think he reached a point where his interest
and the interest of the Nation diverged.
translation.ko: 네이션 오브 이슬람의 관심사가 나뉘는 지점에 도달했을 거예요

translation.en: And, of course, this leads to more tension, more conflict.
translation.ko: 그러면 당연히 긴장과 갈등이 더 커지죠

translation.en: [Ilyasah] "I liked him."
"Some contagious quality about him
made him one of the very few people I ever invited to my home."
[Randy] They would talk.
They probably talked on the phone,
but it's all secretive.
But the Louisville Sponsoring Group
were starting to pick up what was going on.
They began to realize
that Cassius was affiliated with the Muslims.
translation.ko: 캐시어스가 무슬림에 소속됐단 걸 알게 됐죠

translation.en: They began to step back.
And suddenly, in Cassius Clay's rhetoric,
we start to hear the echo of Malcolm X.
translation.ko: 갑자기 맬컴 엑스의 이야기가 들리는 거예요

translation.en: [Dr. Smith] July, 1963, Chicago.
Bruce Hills, a reporter for the Chicago Sun-Times,
is camped outside of the University of Islam,
translation.ko: 이슬람 대학교 밖에서 진을 치고 기다려요

translation.en: which is the Nation of Islam's school.
translation.ko: 네이션 오브 이슬람이 세운 학교죠 "이슬람 대학교"

translation.en: Somehow, he learns that there's a tomato-red Cadillac
parked behind the University of Islam.
translation.ko: 이슬람 대학교 뒤에 주차돼 있다는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: Cassius and Rudy and a few others come out.
translation.ko: 캐시어스와 루디와 다른 몇 명이 나왔어요

translation.en: [Dr. Smith] Bruce Hills gets excited. His eyes light up,
and he starts following Cassius' car.
Bruce gets Cassius to roll down the window.
[Randy] And he sees Cassius has a star and crescent pin on.
translation.ko: 캐시어스가 초승달과 별 모양 핀을 착용한 걸 보죠

translation.en: "What's going on? Are you a member of the Nation of Islam?"
[Dr. Smith] And at first, Cassius Clay says, "No."
-And then he says… -[Randy] "Well, so what if I am?"
"It's a great organization."
And it continues until Rudy turns onto the freeway out of Chicago.
translation.ko: 루디가 고속도로로 진입할 때까지 상황은 계속돼요

translation.en: [Dr. Smith] Now, the story published by Bruce Hills,
it doesn't quite gain momentum yet in the press.
But it's obvious that he has a relationship with the Nation of Islam.
translation.ko: 하지만 캐시어스는 분명 네이션 오브 이슬람과 교류했죠

translation.en: The fact that Cassius Clay was somehow connected to this group
translation.ko: 캐시어스 클레이가 이 단체와 연관됐다는 사실에

translation.en: made a lot of white people nervous.
[reporter] And the FBI says the movement is a potential threat
to the internal security of the United States.
[Dr. Smith] J. Edgar Hoover was the director of the FBI,
translation.ko: J. 에드거 후버는 케네디 정부 시절에

translation.en: working for the Kennedy administration.
Hoover and the FBI carried out a counterintelligence program
designed to cut the legs out from Elijah Muhammad and Malcolm X.
translation.ko: 일라이자 무하마드와 맬컴 엑스의 수족을 자르도록 설계됐어요

translation.en: [Zaheer] Not just passive surveillance,
but active infiltration
designed to undermine the impact
that the Nation of Islam was having,
to neutralize the impact that Malcolm was having.
[Elijah] Every day now, they are planning
how to stop Elijah and his followers.
-[crowd exclaims] -But I say, I think you a little late.
[President Kennedy] We are confronted primarily with a moral issue.
It is as old as the Scriptures
and is as clear as the American Constitution.
The heart of the question is,
whether all Americans are to be afforded equal rights
and equal opportunities.
Whether we are going to treat our fellow Americans
as we want to be treated.
[reporter 1] From Dallas, Texas, the flash, apparently official,
President Kennedy died at 1 p.m. Central Standard Time.
translation.ko: 중부 표준시 오후 1시에 케네디 대통령이 사망했습니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] Down this avenue of sadness, they bring President John F. Kennedy,
translation.ko: 이 슬픔의 길 끝에 존 F. 케네디 대통령

translation.en: martyred hero,
to lie in state under the great dome of the Capitol.
[John] When Kennedy died,
Elijah Muhammad instructed all the temples
to leave it to him to express the feelings of the Nation
translation.ko: 대통령의 죽음에 관한 네이션 오브 이슬람의 입장을

translation.en: about the death of the president.
[reporter 3] Elijah Muhammad, from his home in Phoenix, telephoned the newspaper
translation.ko: 일라이자 무하마드는 피닉스 집에서 신문사에 전화해

translation.en: ordering that a statement be placed on page one.
The statement reads,
"We with the world are very shocked at the assassination of our President."
[Shabazz-Allah] I have to respect what the Messenger said.
No statement should be made.
I-- I got that.
For me, if you teaching the white man is the devil…
…who the hell is Kennedy?
Far as I'm concerned, he didn't do a damn thing for me.
translation.ko: 케네디는 날 위해 한 게 없어요

translation.en: [chuckling] I mean, I still got--
I still got to provide for myself. He ain't put no money in my pocket.
translation.ko: 케네디는 내 주머니에 돈을 꽂아 주지 않았다고요

translation.en: But I have to go with my father, the Most Honorable Elijah Muhammad.
translation.ko: 하지만 일라이자 무하마드의 뜻을 따라야 해요

translation.en: He did make it plain, don't make no statements.
[John] In spite of the Messenger's instructions,
Malcolm spoke.
Malcolm X, second in command of the Black Muslim movement,
translation.ko: 블랙 무슬림 운동의 부사령관인 맬컴 엑스가

translation.en: expressed joy at the assassination of President Kennedy
at a Manhattan rally last Sunday.
Malcolm said that the killing of the President
was an instance of "the chickens coming home to roost."
translation.ko: 닭이 닭장으로 돌아오듯 당연한 결과라고 했습니다

translation.en: He added, and we quote,
"Being an old farm boy myself,
chickens coming home to roost never make me sad,
translation.ko: '닭이 닭장으로 돌아오는 게 전혀 슬프지 않고'

translation.en: they always make me glad."
In Chicago today, Elijah Muhammad,
the leader of the anti-white Muslim movement,
translation.ko: 반백인 무슬림 운동의 지도자인 일라이자 무하마드는

translation.en: suspended Malcolm X and disavowed his statement.
It gave Elijah Muhammad a socially acceptable excuse
for silencing Malcolm.
[Dr. Smith] He's not allowed to preach,
he's not allowed to appear at his mosque in Harlem.
And in fact, the members of that mosque
are not allowed to be associated with Malcolm.
[Peter] This was a big breach in his life.
He regarded Elijah Muhammad as his personal savior.
The Most Honorable Elijah Muhammad.
[Peter] His feelings were unquestionably deep, devout.
translation.ko: 그 상처는 의심할 여지 없이 깊었어요

translation.en: [Malcolm] I want to apologize to you for having let you down,
for the mistakes that I've made, especially during the past year.
And above all else, I am praying to Allah
for mercy and forgiveness in your heart.
He is torn here between this idea that Elijah Muhammad is like his father,
translation.ko: 내적 갈등이 심했어요 일라이자 무하마드를 아버지처럼 여기지만

translation.en: and the fact that his father has got his hand around Malcolm's throat.
translation.ko: 그 아버지가 자기 목을 조르고 있으니까요

translation.en: This growing rift was going to be a big problem
translation.ko: 점점 커지는 균열은 큰 문제가 되고 말아요

translation.en: for, among other people, Muhammad Ali.
[Muhammad] If Sonny Liston whups me,
I'll kiss his feet in the rain,
tell him he's the greatest, and catch the next jet out of the country!
translation.ko: 소니가 위대하다고 말하고 당장 미국을 뜨겠어요

translation.en: That's what I think about Sonny Liston!
[Dr. Boyd] You have, in Liston and Ali, a thug on one side
and a loudmouth on the other side.
You can look at me, I'm loaded with confidence!
I can't be beat!
I had 180 amateur fights, 22 professional fights,
and I'm pretty as a girl!
People were scared to death of Liston.
Sonny Liston was a boxer who came out of the penitentiary,
who worked for organized crime as a leg-breaker.
You owed some money, you'd get a visit from Sonny.
He'll fall in eight to prove that I'm great.
And if he keeps talking jive, I'm gonna cut it to five.
[Zaheer] Cassius, because of what he was focused on,
training for that major fight,
I don't think he was attuned to all of the internal dynamics
translation.ko: 네이션 오브 이슬람 내부의 이런저런 문제를

translation.en: in the Nation of Islam.
[Dr. Smith] On January 15th, 1964, Malcolm, he's gonna head south.
He's going to Miami with his family to visit Cassius Clay.
translation.ko: 가족과 함께 마이애미로 캐시어스 클레이를 보러 가죠

translation.en: So, in advance of the trip, he calls Cassius,
and Cassius responds, "Great."
He's enthusiastic, he's excited to see him.
We know this call took place between Malcolm and Cassius,
because a New York FBI agent
immediately called the field office in Miami
and provided a directive.
"Malcolm is arriving on this specific flight."
"Cassius Clay is going to be there."
"Make sure you tail their car."
[Ilyasah] Miami was the only place
where we had gone as a family together on vacation
and to be in someone else's home.
translation.ko: 마이애미에 갔을 때가 유일해요 "캐시어스 클레이의 집 플로리다주 마이애미"

translation.en: That family photo of my mother
and my two elder sisters, Attallah and Qubilah,
and I'm sitting on Muhammad Ali's lap.
translation.ko: 전 무하마드 알리의 무릎에 앉아 있어요

translation.en: For my father to take his wife and his babies
and go to his home,
it meant that my father trusted him 100%.
My dad considered him to be a friend. He considered him to be family, really.
translation.ko: 아버지는 맬컴을 친구라고 심지어 가족이라고 생각했어요

translation.en: And Malcolm was one of those few people that he met that he could trust.
translation.ko: 맬컴은 아버지가 신뢰하는 몇 안 되는 사람이었어요

translation.en: [Zaheer] Malcolm was in need of allies.
He'd become isolated in the movement.
Cassius could be the big fish.
I think that is very possibly part of Malcolm's calculation.
[Herb] You can't dismiss the possibility that he had those particular motives,
translation.ko: 자기 잇속을 챙기려고 특정한 동기를 갖고

translation.en: that it could be self-serving.
Somebody can-- You know, I can use and utilize,
because of his growing influentiality,
that he could help me too.
[Dr. Smith] Malcolm sends these pictures to two Black newspapers.
translation.ko: 맬컴이 이 사진들을 두 흑인 신문사에 보내요

translation.en: Malcolm wants to remind Elijah Muhammad
that Cassius Clay has the ability
to bring more members into the movement, and they're as close as brothers.
translation.ko: 더 많은 사람을 끌어들일 수 있고 두 사람이 친하단 걸 알린 거죠

translation.en: [Randy] Malcolm says to Elijah Muhammad, "What would it be like
translation.ko: 맬컴이 일라이자 무하마드에게 구주의 날 기념식에...

translation.en: if for Savior's Day celebration…"
which was the day after the fight, "…if I show up with Cassius Clay?"
translation.ko: 경기 다음 날이었는데 캐시어스 클레이를 데려오면 어떻겠냐고 물어요 "선수권 대회"

translation.en: [Maryum] "I wanna come back, Honorable Messenger,
and I have someone who can help our cause."
[Jerry] About a week before the fight,
Malcolm X shows up.
Malcolm goes to a couple of workouts in the camp.
He had been asked to leave
and go home.
That he could come back for the fight.
The real emphasis at that point
was whether or not Cassius Clay
was a member of the Nation of Islam.
They didn't want some Muslim being the heavyweight champion,
translation.ko: 무슬림이 헤비급 챔피언이 되길 바라지 않아서

translation.en: so they basically threatened him.
Cassius was about to pack up the bus to leave town,
translation.ko: 캐시어스가 버스를 타고 동네를 떠나려고 했어요

translation.en: since they said they were canceling the fight,
but the promoters find out he was leaving, they came back and said,
translation.ko: 기획사에서 캐시어스가 떠나는 걸 알고 돌아와서 이랬죠

translation.en: "You just don't tell nobody you're Muslim. We won't say nothing."
translation.ko: '무슬림이라고 말하지 마 우리도 아무 말 안 할게'

translation.en: [Randy] February 25th, 1964.
Heavyweight championship of the world.
Malcolm has come back to Miami.
[promoter] Miami, Florida, where the Torch of Friendship
signifies a welcome to good people of all races and creeds.
translation.ko: 다양한 인종과 신념의 선한 사람들을 환영합니다

translation.en: [Dr. Smith] Remember, Miami is a segregated city,
and he has to stay at a hotel that is only for Black people.
[promoter] From the moment you drive up to the main entrance of the Hampton House,
your welcome is assured.
A home away from home
to thousands of visitors from states of the United States
and many foreign lands,
who seek the fabulous Florida sunshine.
If you like to lose your money, then be a fool and bet on Sonny.
translation.ko: 돈을 잃고 싶으면 바보처럼 소니한테 걸어요

translation.en: But if you wanna have a good day, then put it on Clay.
translation.ko: 좋은 하루를 보내고 싶으면 클레이한테 걸고요

translation.en: [Robert] I always thought Sonny Liston
was really afraid of only one thing, and that was a crazy man.
translation.ko: 한 가지를 무서워한다고 생각했는데 바로 미친놈이죠

translation.en: He'd come out of the system, and he'd spent time in jail
where he had seen people go nuts.
Cassius used that,
harassing him, making fun of him.
At the weigh-in, he went nuts,
tried to get at Sonny Liston.
A crazy man who had nothing to lose could really hurt you.
translation.ko: 잃을 게 없는 미친놈은 아주 위험해요

translation.en: [reporter] We're almost all set to go
for that world heavyweight championship fight.
translation.ko: 헤비급 세계 선수권 대회가 곧 시작합니다

translation.en: The puncher, champion Sonny Liston,
the boxer, challenger Cassius Clay.
[Randy] Just before the fight, Cassius is nervous.
This is a big fight. He's--
translation.ko: 큰 경기니까요 악당인 소니 리스턴과 싸우는 거예요

translation.en: He's going to fight Sonny Liston, who is a bad man.
Suddenly, Malcolm X shows up in the locker room.
[Rahman] They made prayer. He talked to my brother,
gave my brother some instructions, and my brother came out very confident.
translation.ko: 맬컴의 지도를 받은 형은 탈의실에서 나왔을 때 자신감이 넘쳤어요

translation.en: [Zaheer] Malcolm encouraged him to believe
that he had to bring with him into that ring
translation.ko: 자신과 함께 링으로 가야 한다고 했어요

translation.en: the power of God, if not God himself.
[announcer] We're set for an exciting night here in Convention Hall, Miami Beach.
translation.ko: 마이애미비치 컨벤션 홀에서 신나는 밤을 보낼 겁니다

translation.en: [Ilyasah] You know, with the support of your brother,
who believes just as deeply as you do,
you can pray to God
to give you the will to do what you must.
translation.ko: 잘할 수 있는 의지를 달라고 기도해요

translation.en: [announcer] Now the questions will be answered.
If it goes past the first round, there will be surprises already.
[Randy] Malcolm got a seat sitting in row seven, seat seven.
This is prophecy coming to truth.
-[bell sounds] -[announcer] And here they come.
Clay just laughs at him, backs away, bobbing, weaving.
Clay with a left and a right at play!
Liston's caught! Liston's bleeding under both eyes!
translation.ko: 리스턴이 잡힙니다 양쪽 눈 밑에 피를 흘립니다

translation.en: [Howard Cosell] The bell sounds for the fifth round, and he is having trouble with his eyes.
[announcer] His trainer yelled, "There's something in Liston's gloves."
translation.ko: 트레이너 한 명이 리스턴의 글러브에 뭐가 있답니다

translation.en: Clay is blinking, said he can't see.
translation.ko: 클레이가 눈을 깜빡이며 안 보인다고 합니다

translation.en: Here is Liston crouching, hitting the low body.
And Clay keeps blinking like he doesn't see Liston,
translation.ko: 클레이는 리스턴이 안 보이는 듯 계속 깜빡입니다

translation.en: and that will be fatal.
His great body and head movements kept him from Liston's punches.
translation.ko: 몸과 머리 움직임으로 리스턴의 주먹을 피합니다

translation.en: [announcer] Round five saw Cassius come back on the attack.
All through this fight,
Cassius has ripped that left hand into Sonny Liston's face.
translation.ko: 캐시어스가 왼손으로 소니 리스턴의 얼굴을 가격했죠

translation.en: And here in the sixth round, Clay has taken control of the fight.
Round six ends. Liston moves very wearily to his corner.
[Howard Cosell] As we come up to round seven…
Wait a minute!
Sonny Liston's not coming out!
The winner and the new heavyweight champion of the world
is Cassius Clay!
Every time I watch it, I still get goosebumps.
[Howard Cosell] Pandemonium has broken loose.
When he goes around the ring, and he points everybody out,
"I told you, I told you."
"I told you I was the greatest. I proved it."
That moment, it'll stick with you the rest of your life.
translation.ko: 그 순간은 평생 잊지 못할 겁니다

translation.en: I shook up the world!
"I shook up the world."
"I shook up the world."
I shook up the world!
He said he was the greatest, uh, all of the odds were against him.
He upset the oddsmakers.
He won. He became victorious. He became the champ.
And the, uh, people who, uh-- Who understand psychology
and the-- The effect that, uh-- The psychological effect
translation.ko: 그 효과를 알 거예요 심리적 효과가 있거든요

translation.en: that the image of one's hero has upon the person himself…
they knew that as soon as, uh-- If people begin to identify with Cassius,
and the ki-- Type of image he was creating,
they would have trouble out of these Negroes.
Because they'd have Negroes walking around saying, "I'm the greatest."
Cassius say, "I am something righteous."
Cassius Clay, the greatest!
-Who's the prettiest fighter in history? -Cassius Clay!
translation.ko: 역사상 가장 예쁜 파이터가 누구죠? 캐시어스 클레이!

translation.en: -He is the greatest! -All right.
Fly like a butterfly, stings like a bee!
They leave the convention center, a small group of people.
Rudy, Cassius, Malcolm X,
Jim Brown, the great football player at the time,
translation.ko: 당시 최고의 풋볼 선수인 짐 브라운과

translation.en: Sam Cooke, the unbelievable recording artist,
who's a good friend of Cassius.
And they come here…
[Randy] …to the Hampton House.
Cassius and Rudy sit back here on these very stools.
[Dr. Smith] Cassius Clay the champion, eating a bowl of ice cream.
That was his idea of a big celebration, was a bowl of ice cream.
[stammers] One of the happiest times of my life.
Everybody was celebrating victory.
[Dr. Smith] Now, it's in this moment that they all say, "Well, we believed in you,"
translation.ko: 그 순간에 모두 캐시어스를 믿었다고 말했지만

translation.en: but it was Malcolm who believed in him.
[Dr. Smith] And that means something.
It's with gratitude that he celebrates with Malcolm.
It's getting late,
and the story goes that Malcolm, Cassius Clay, Rudy, Jim Brown,
translation.ko: 맬컴, 캐시어스 클레이 루디, 짐 브라운

translation.en: maybe a few others…
[Randy] They go to Malcolm X's room.
It's time to talk serious now.
Now Malcolm X is saying, "You know,
this Louisville Lip, it's time to end that."
"You've got the title, you've got the pulpit…
now you gotta start talking right."
translation.ko: 이제 제대로 말해야죠 "햄프턴 하우스 무하마드 알리의 방"

translation.en: [Dr. Smith] We weren't in the room.
We don't have a recording of those conversations.
All we know is what happens next.
He was able…
…by confessing Allah is God
and Muhammad is his messenger…
…that he whipped a much tougher man than he.
The enemy wanted him to come out all blasted.
They had said that he would-- [chuckles]
Liston would tear up that pretty face of yours.
translation.ko: 리스턴이 예쁜 얼굴을 찢어 버릴 거랬죠

translation.en: But Allah and myself said "No, no."
[reporter] And do you think that Cassius' being a Black Muslim
has had anything to do with this victory?
Well, I haven't heard him say he was a Black Muslim.
translation.ko: 본인이 블랙 무슬림이라고 말하는 건 못 들었어요

translation.en: I have heard him say that he believes in the religion of Islam.
[Dr. Smith] About a week after the fight between Clay and Liston,
they go to the United Nations.
Malcolm X, I want to talk with you briefly about your affiliation with Cassius.
translation.ko: 맬컴 엑스, 캐시어스와의 관계를 잠깐 얘기하고 싶군요

translation.en: How long have you known him?
About three years.
[reporter] And have you been advising him, uh,
as far as his religious affiliations are concerned?
Well, no, I don't give advice to anyone. He's my brother and my friend.
translation.ko: 전 아무한테도 조언하지 않아요 제 형제이자 친구일 뿐이죠

translation.en: I express what I know and understand around him.
translation.ko: 제가 알고 이해하는 걸 표현할 뿐이에요

translation.en: And Malcolm X introduces him to Black diplomats from all over Africa.
translation.ko: 맬컴 엑스는 아프리카 전역의 흑인 외교관들을 소개해 줘요

translation.en: There's my buddy. Yes, sir.
Glad to see you.
[Dr. Smith] And this is where Malcolm reminds him,
"You are not what you were before."
"Now you are someone who is looked up to all over the world."
Do you plan to visit Nigeria on your trip?
Yes, sir. That's one of my main stops, Africa.
translation.ko: 네, 아프리카 주요 목적지 중 하나예요

translation.en: Malcolm wanted to play on a larger stage.
translation.ko: 맬컴은 더 큰 무대에서 놀고 싶어 했어요

translation.en: He was going to take the race situation
and internationalize it.
Take it to the UN.
The United States was pushing itself as the leader of the free world,
translation.ko: 미국은 자유 세계의 지도자이자 인권 지지자라는 역할을

translation.en: the supporter of human rights,
and brother Malcolm was out there saying,
"Hey, y'all, this is simply not happening."
Malcolm knew that this would be something
that would compel the federal government to move.
translation.ko: 연방 정부를 압박할 수 있다는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: [Malcolm] Cassius is in a better position than anyone else
to restore a sense of racial pride
translation.ko: 인종적 자부심을 회복할 수 있는 위치에 있습니다

translation.en: to not only our people in this country, but all over the world.
translation.ko: 미국의 흑인뿐만 아니라 전 세계의 흑인을 위해서요

translation.en: [Dr. Smith] Over the course of the week, Malcolm and Cassius
translation.ko: 그 주에 맬컴과 캐시어스는 더없이 가까웠어요

translation.en: look like they've never been closer.
They go to Times Square,
and they go and they watch the fight of Clay defeating Liston.
[Howard Cosell] The winner and new heavyweight champion of the world is Cassius Clay!
translation.ko: 우승자이자 새로운 세계 헤비급 챔피언은 캐시어스 클레이입니다!

translation.en: When they come out of the theater, what do you see?
translation.ko: 극장에서 나오니 어떤 광경이 펼쳐져 있을까요?

translation.en: A crowd, hundreds of people, surrounding them.
Reporters are asking Malcolm questions
about whether or not the champ is gonna be in his movement.
There are all these questions about what's gonna happen next.
translation.ko: 앞으로 어떻게 될지 다들 궁금해해요 "맬컴 엑스와의 관계가 커리어에 문제가 될까?"

translation.en: There's an FBI agent in Chicago
who is requesting continued surveillance of Elijah Muhammad's mansion.
translation.ko: 일라이자 무하마드의 저택을 계속 감시하라고 요청해요

translation.en: And this agent learns
that Elijah Muhammad has had phone conversations
with the heavyweight champion.
On March 6th, 1964,
Cassius returns to his room back at the Hotel Theresa.
translation.ko: 캐시어스는 테리사 호텔의 자신의 방으로 돌아와서

translation.en: He gets a phone call, and it's Elijah Muhammad.
And the Supreme Minister tells him,
"You are not allowed to associate with Malcolm anymore."
[reporter] I understand that you're headed for Chicago later on this afternoon
to meet with Elijah Muhammad?
-Yes, sir. I'm having dinner with him. -[reporter] Uh-huh.
One of the main reasons for you joining the Black Muslims
translation.ko: 블랙 무슬림에 가입한 주된 이유 중 하나는

translation.en: was your friendship with Malcolm X, wasn't it?
No, I was a Muslim four years before I met Malcolm X.
translation.ko: 아니요, 난 맬컴 엑스를 만나기 4년 전부터 무슬림이었어요

translation.en: [reporter] Oh, really?
Uh, he's a friend of yours now though, isn't he?
-Yeah. -[reporter] He was--
He's a brother of mine. He's my brother. Whatever he do, he's my brother.
[reporter] Uh-huh. Now that he's split away from the Muslims--
translation.ko: 무엇을 하든 맬컴은 내 형제예요 이제 무슬림과 멀어졌으니...

translation.en: I don't know about splitting.
I'll have to see a higher authority on that.
translation.ko: 그 얘기를 하기 전에 상황 파악부터 해야 해요

translation.en: That's one of my main reasons for going, is to find out the real story.
I don't believe nothing the press and people write.
translation.ko: 언론과 사람들이 쓴 글은 믿지 않아요

translation.en: [Rahman] Elijah Muhammad says,
"For all my followers and all my people that believe in Islam,
this is the brother, Cassius Clay,
he's the most trusted follower that I got."
"And I name him…
Muhammad Ali."
That's how he got the name.
[Peter] Cassius Clay is given his Muslim name, Muhammad Ali.
Most people had to wait for years to get that.
He became a hero.
He appeared on the stage with the Messenger.
And Malcolm was…
out in the cold.
[Herb] Muhammad Ali, then, is in the crosshairs
translation.ko: 그때 무하마드 알리 입장이 곤란했어요 "클레이는 잔류"

translation.en: between two very powerful individuals,
two powerful Black leaders, Elijah Muhammad and Malcolm X,
whether he was aware of that or not.
When forced to choose,
for Malcolm, he had no choice but to choose himself.
For Cassius, he had to choose his spiritual father.
Malcolm was an individual.
Elijah was an institution.
Does this split disturb you, that has been reported?
No, what Malcolm X does is his business. He's one man.
translation.ko: 아니요, 맬컴 엑스는 개인이니 뭘 하든 상관없어요

translation.en: -Your leader is Elijah Muhammad? -Yes, sir.
[Shabazz-Allah] The Messenger was our father.
A father we never had and always wanted.
[Shabazz-Allah] He was like the blood in our veins.
There's no Melchisedek without the Messenger's teachings.
translation.ko: 신의 사자의 가르침이 없으면 난 존재하지 않아요

translation.en: Take these teachings, I'm just another nigga in the street.
translation.ko: 그 가르침이 없다면 비렁뱅이와 다를 바가 없어요

translation.en: You understand what I'm trying to say?
[Maryum] It was a simple story line,
and my father was right up in the middle of it,
as this young man trying to choose.
translation.ko: 한 청년이 선택의 기로에 선 거예요

translation.en: And, yeah, there could have been an element of survival.
Cassius Clay is a name no more, is that right?
Yes, sir. It's Muhammad Ali.
Muhammad means "worthy of all praises," and Ali means "most high."
[Randy] When Malcolm heard this,
Malcolm exploded in a car and said, "That's political."
Has anybody special gave you the name?
translation.ko: 특별한 사람이 그 이름을 지어 줬나요?

translation.en: Yes, sir. My leader and teacher, the Most Honorable Elijah Muhammad.
He knew that in the battle to win the heart of Muhammad Ali,
he had lost the fight.
translation.ko: 자신이 진 걸 알았어요 "클레이의 새 이름 무하마드 알리"

translation.en: Muhammad. My name's Muhammad.
Y'all keep calling me Cassius. I'm tired of telling ya.
You know, you're intelligent. My name is Muhammad Ali, not Cassius.
translation.ko: 똑똑한 분이면서 왜 자꾸 내 이름을 까먹죠?

translation.en: Ali would not let America define him,
translation.ko: 알리는 미국이 자신을 정의하게 하지 않았고

translation.en: and he wouldn't even let them name him.
[reporter] Muhammad Ali, more popularly known as Gaseous Cassius,
has just hit town for his…
[Rev. Sharpton] All of the endorsements, all of the commercials,
Hollywood, all of that's open to you,
translation.ko: 할리우드 등 모든 게 열려 있는데

translation.en: and changing your name closes the door to all of that.
translation.ko: 이름을 바꾸면 그 문이 닫혀 버려요

translation.en: It would take a lot of courage in the 21st century, but it was unthinkable--
You would have to be out of your mind.
translation.ko: 제정신이 아니고선 생각할 수도 없었어요 "나는 무하마드 알리"

translation.en: It was the ultimate statement.
-[reporter] Mr. Clay, when you-- -Muhammad Ali, sir.
-[reporter] Mr. Clay-- -Muhammad Ali, sir.
-[reporter] Mr. Muhammad Ali, either one. -Yes, sir.
-Just Muhammad Ali, sir. -When you appeared…
And all of a sudden, people said, "Who does he think he is? A loudmouth N--"
translation.ko: 갑자기 사람들이 그랬죠 '자기가 뭐라고 설쳐? 입만 산 검둥이 자식'

translation.en: "The loudmouth N. Who does he think he is?"
translation.ko: '입만 산 검둥이 자식이 자기가 뭐라고 설쳐?'

translation.en: "Go to take a different name, different religion."
It's a insult to be called Cassius Clay, 'cause I'm not white.
translation.ko: 백인이 아닌데 캐시어스라고 부르는 건 모욕이에요

translation.en: I'm Muhammad Ali. I'm a Black man.
It's the name of our history, our ancestry.
So now it's an honor, coming into the knowledge of self,
to be called by my own name.
How would a Russian look named George Washington?
translation.ko: 이름이 조지 워싱턴인데 러시아인처럼 생기면 어떻겠어요?

translation.en: -Tell me again, who's the champ? -[crowd] Muhammad Ali!
-Again. Who's that? -[crowd] Muhammad Ali!
You have Muslims around the world
who maybe never followed a boxing match,
translation.ko: 아마 복싱 경기를 한 번도 안 봤을 텐데

translation.en: now are hearing this name emanating over the press wires:
translation.ko: 언론에서 한 이름이 자꾸 들리는 거예요

translation.en: Muhammad Ali, Muhammad Ali.
[Herb] 1964, Muhammad and Malcolm
traveled to Africa and the Middle East,
but not together.
They both had this concern
for the whole winds of change that are growing across Africa.
translation.ko: 아프리카 전역에서 변화의 바람이 불고 있었거든요

translation.en: Muhammad Ali was met with all these adoring masses of people.
He was mesmerizing in so many different ways.
The kind of charisma that he possessed, you know, it's extraordinary.
And Malcolm is traveling alone.
Meeting with these here world leaders,
he was trying to bring the message of 22 million African-Americans
to the world stage…
-Salaam alaikum. -[crowd] Walaikum Salaam.
…and bring charges, you know, against the US.
in terms of their violation of human rights.
Our problem is not an American problem, it's a human problem.
translation.ko: 우리의 문제는 미국만이 아니라 인류의 문제입니다

translation.en: It's not a Negro problem, it's a problem of humanity.
[Herb] He's like a representative, a congressman,
a senator from Black America,
if not the president of Black America.
[Ilyasah] "The Muslim from America
excited everywhere the most intense curiosity and interest."
"I was mistaken time and again for Cassius Clay."
"A local newspaper had printed a photograph
of Cassius and me together at the United Nations."
"At that moment, he had captured the imagination
and the support of the entire dark world."
My father always spoke about the redemption of Africa.
And "Redemption Song" was an homage, if you will, to Marcus Garvey,
translation.ko: '구원의 노래'는 마커스 가비에게 경의를 표한 거였죠

translation.en: and a statement that Marcus Garvey made in 1937,
that we must liberate our minds from mental slavery,
because while others may help us to liberate our bodies,
none but ourselves can liberate our minds.
translation.ko: 우리 자신만이 마음을 해방할 수 있다고요

translation.en: ♪ None but ourselves can free our minds ♪
I think Malcolm started to see himself, I believe, uh,
taking on that mantle.
♪ While we stand aside and look? Ooh ♪
translation.ko: "'포스트' 맬컴 엑스" "범죄, 전향, 블랙 무슬림에 관한 자신의 이야기"

translation.en: [Malcolm] Because of the spiritual rebirth,
which I was blessed to undergo
as a result of the pilgrimage to the holy city of Mecca,
I no longer subscribe to sweeping indictments of any one race.
translation.ko: 전 이제 한 인종을 고발하는 걸 믿지 않습니다

translation.en: ♪ Redemption songs… ♪
[Dr. Smith] May 17th, 1964,
Accra, Ghana,
outside the Ambassador Hotel…
Malcolm was with some of his American expat friends,
Maya Angelou and others.
Malcolm is being taken to the airport,
and outside the hotel,
and here comes Muhammad Ali.
[Dr. Smith] Now, keep in mind that Malcolm,
he's been to Egypt and Saudi Arabia,
and in his journal,
he writes about Ali as his brother and his friend.
So in this moment, in Accra, Ghana,
when he surprisingly sees the champ,
he thinks that they're going to embrace as brothers.
[Randy] Malcolm X keeps saying, "Muhammad, Muhammad."
Finally, Muhammad Ali turns to him and says,
"Look, you turned your back on Elijah Muhammad."
translation.ko: 마침내 무하마드 알리가 돌아서서 말해요 '넌 일라이자 무하마드를 배신했어'

translation.en: "You were wrong, brother. You were wrong."
He turns around and walks away.
[Herb] He kind of snubbed Malcolm at that point.
Their relationship had pretty much soured, torn apart.
Maya Angelou would later write about how, when Malcolm gets in the car,
translation.ko: 마야 앤절루는 나중에 맬컴이 차에 탔을 때

translation.en: he's slumped in the passenger seat.
He says, "I've lost so much."
He's lost Elijah Muhammad,
who had played a paternal role in his life,
and now he's lost Muhammad Ali.
If that's the blood brotherhood we're talking about,
I think it was probably the end of the blood brotherhood.
[reporter] What's your plan now?
[Malcolm] I'm going back to the, uh, States,
first to see how my family is doing.
-[reporter] Yes. -[Malcolm] See what develops.
When he returned from Africa at JFK Airport,
my mother handed me over to my father,
and he's smiling. I don't know if that's a fond memory,
translation.ko: 아버지는 웃고 있죠 그게 좋은 기억이어서인지

translation.en: or if it's because I've seen the photo so many times,
translation.ko: 그 사진을 너무 많이 봐서인지 몰라도

translation.en: but I feel like I see him looking at me
like he's waiting for something to happen.
translation.ko: 일이 생길 거라고 짐작하시는 것 같아요

translation.en: And this is a golden Muslim mosque
that was presented to me by the Islamic Council of all Egypt.
translation.ko: 이집트 이슬람 협의회에서 저한테 준 겁니다

translation.en: [man 2] It's all solid gold, brother.
All solid gold.
Solid gold.
[man 3] Solid gold! Yes…
This is a gift to our leader and teacher for waking all of us up,
translation.ko: 우리 모두를 일깨운 지도자께 선물로 드리겠습니다

translation.en: because we were in a bad state of condition before we heard him.
[man 3] Yes, sir!
[man 4] Hooray! Yes, sir!
Have you and Malcolm X, the man who helped convert you
translation.ko: 맬컴 엑스는 당신을 블랙 무슬림 운동으로 끌어들인 사람인데

translation.en: to the Black Muslim movement,
translation.ko: 당신을 블랙 무슬림 운동으로 끌어들인 사람인데

translation.en: have the two of you split?
When the Honorable Elijah Muhammad cuts a man off,
translation.ko: 일라이자 무하마드가 한 사람을 끊어 내면

translation.en: well then he's automatically cut off with all of his followers.
My newspaper carried a story saying upon your return from Africa,
you refused to stay at the Theresa Hotel, your former headquarters.
translation.ko: 원래 지냈던 테리사 호텔에 머물지 않겠다고 했어요

translation.en: My leader told me-- Not my leader, but various officials
translation.ko: 제 지도자가 말씀하시길... 아니, 여러 사제가 말하길

translation.en: said that it wouldn't be nice being in the same hotel that he was in,
translation.ko: 맬컴과 같은 호텔에 묵는 게 좋지 않대요

translation.en: and whatever they say go.
[reporter] When Cassius Clay was in Accra,
he was quoted as saying things that were, um, not so friendly.
translation.ko: 그리 좋지 않은 말을 했다고 들었습니다

translation.en: Uh, could you have anything to say about that?
I don't know anything about what he said.
I'm always reluctant to believe what I read in the newspaper
that one Black man supposedly said about another Black man.
translation.ko: 특히 흑인이 다른 흑인한테 한 말에 관한 기사요

translation.en: [reporter] He was--
And if I have anything at all to say about Cassius, I'll say it to him.
translation.ko: 캐시어스에 관해 할 말이 있으면 전 직접 말할 겁니다

translation.en: I don't even talk about Malcolm X.
translation.ko: 전 맬컴 엑스 얘기도 안 해요

translation.en: He's not in our mind. He's a little--
We don't worry about Malcolm X. We have too much to do,
translation.ko: 맬컴 엑스는 걱정 안 해요 할 일이 너무 많아서요

translation.en: and he's just one individual who, as we say, went astray.
translation.ko: 맬컴은 길을 잃은 한 사람일 뿐이에요

translation.en: [reporter] Do you still consider him a friend?
Yes, I consider all of our people my friend.
translation.ko: 네, 전 모든 흑인을 친구라고 생각해요

translation.en: And usually, those who act unfriendly
are only reflecting the poison that someone else has put in them.
translation.ko: 다른 사람의 영향을 받아 휘둘리는 것뿐이죠

translation.en: I-- I'm wondering if you still believe, as I think you certainly did
at the time you were allied with the Black Muslim movement,
in a segregated Black nation in North America?
I don't believe in any form of segregation or any form of racism.
translation.ko: 전 어떠한 인종 분리나 인종 차별에 반대합니다

translation.en: -Are you still a Muslim? -[Malcolm] Oh yes.
I'm a Muslim. I believe in the religion of Islam,
which believes in brotherhood.
Complete brotherhood of all people.
Malcolm felt that he was now a big man before the public,
translation.ko: 맬컴은 자신이 대단한 사람이라도 된 줄 아는데

translation.en: and this seemed to have been his desire.
He wanted to be seen and heard.
He wanted to exalt himself above his teacher.
translation.ko: 스승보다 더 높이 올라가고 싶어 했어요

translation.en: [Zaheer] Once Malcolm is labeled a hypocrite…
…it marks him.
What people think hypocrite means
or permits them to contemplate to do,
translation.ko: 위선자에게 해도 된다고 믿는 행동을 생각하면

translation.en: puts him in an extremely vulnerable position.
[Wali] We definitely look at that as one of the worst things you could do,
is be a hypocrite.
Uh, you know, we don't affiliate ourselves with hypocrites,
and we let Allah take care of our hypocrites.
-[reporter] Why are they threatening you? -Well, primarily because they're afraid
translation.ko: 왜 당신 목숨을 위협하죠? 글쎄요, 아마도

translation.en: that I will tell the real reason that they've been--
translation.ko: 제가 블랙 무슬림 운동을 탈퇴한 진짜 이유를 말할까 봐

translation.en: That I'm out of the Black Muslim movement, which I never told, I kept to myself.
translation.ko: 두려워서겠죠 여태껏 말하지 않고 저 혼자 간직했어요

translation.en: But the real reason is that Elijah Muhammad,
translation.ko: 하지만 진짜 이유는 일라이자 무하마드 때문이에요

translation.en: the head of the movement,
is the father of eight children by six different teenage girls.
translation.ko: 10대 소녀 6명을 임신 시켜 자식 8명을 둔 아버지죠

translation.en: Different, uh-- Six different teenage girls
who were his private personal secretaries.
Shouldn't have talked about him like that. Elijah Muhammad?
translation.ko: 일라이자 무하마드를 두고 그런 식으로 말해선 안 됐어요

translation.en: Taught you everything you knew.
Gonna turn against that man? What a fool.
[Shabazz-Allah] That's a mistake he made.
Your mission and your personal life is separate.
If I got a package for you,
and my mission's to come across the street and give you the package,
translation.ko: 내 임무는 거리를 가로질러 소포를 배달하는 거예요

translation.en: that's my mission.
If you see me across the street with a young girl,
or drinking a quart of wine,
that ain't none of your business.
'Cause I fulfilled my mission.
The Messenger's job is not to discuss or explain his personal life.
translation.ko: 신의 사자가 할 일은 자기 사생활을 설명하는 게 아니죠

translation.en: His job is to deliver the message.
Who in the hell are you to question the Messenger
translation.ko: 도대체 누구라고 감히 신의 사자한테 의문을 제기해요?

translation.en: who took you out of a garbage can, cleaned you up,
and put you in front of the world
as the number-one spokesman for Black people?
Now you gonna question him?
No, no.
[Rahman] When Malcolm did that,
talked about Elijah, said some bad things about his lifestyle
translation.ko: 맬컴은 일라이자를 비난했어요 생활방식과 여자 문제 같은 것들요

translation.en: with women and things like that,
everybody that loved Elijah turned against him.
translation.ko: 그러자 일라이자의 추종자들이 맬컴한테 등을 돌렸어요

translation.en: He shouldn't have said that.
Too many people love Elijah. They would kill for Elijah.
translation.ko: 일라이자의 추종자들은 무슨 짓도 할 준비가 돼 있었어요

translation.en: They did.
[Herb] February the 14th, 1965,
Malcolm's house was firebombed in East Elmhurst.
translation.ko: 퀸스에 있는 맬컴의 집에 화염병이 날아들었어요

translation.en: [reporter] His house in Queens was seriously damaged by fire,
translation.ko: 퀸스 집은 화재로 심각한 피해를 보았습니다

translation.en: a fire started by Molotov cocktails.
[Ilyasah] For my mother, a bomb was thrown into the nursery
where her babies slept.
That has got to be frightening.
My house was bombed.
It was bombed by the Black Muslim movement
upon the orders of Elijah Muhammad.
They had planned to do it from the front and the back
so that I couldn't get out.
I was working the graveyard shift
in one of the automobile plants in Detroit.
He was supposed to be on the schedule to come to Detroit to speak.
When I heard early in the morning hours
that his house had been firebombed in East Elmhurst,
I knew he was not coming.
translation.ko: 당연히 맬컴이 안 올 줄 알았죠

translation.en: I was wrong.
At nine o'clock, Malcolm was on a plane,
translation.ko: 9시가 되자 맬컴은 비행기를 타고 디트로이트로 와서 포드 강당에서 연설했어요

translation.en: came to Detroit, spoke at Ford Auditorium.
A friend of mine attended, said he could smell the smoke on him,
translation.ko: 참석한 친구가 말하길 탄 냄새가 났댔죠

translation.en: what he had salvaged from his house after being firebombed.
[police spokesman] There were about 400 persons present in the ballroom here,
representing the--
An organization known as the Afro-American Unity Organization…
translation.ko: 이들은 한 조직을 대표하는데 아프리카계 미국인 연합 단체로

translation.en: …uh, headed up by Malcolm X.
[A. Peter] The Audubon Ballroom was a huge ballroom,
but it had a very small lobby area.
I was sitting in the lobby, facing the-- The entrance.
translation.ko: 전 입구를 마주하고 로비에 앉아 있었어요

translation.en: I guess I'd been there maybe 10, 15 minutes at the most,
and I heard Brother Malcolm say assalamu alaikum,
and next thing I heard was shots.
[woman] I saw people crawling on the floor,
and so I got down too.
And my children were crying, you know,
"What's going on? What's going on? Are they gonna shoot us?"
I knew they had shot my husband.
[A. Peter] I ran forward.
I saw Malcolm hold his side and hold his stomach and fell down.
We have two suspects in custody now.
One of these men was arrested on the street
by one of our patrolmen close by.
[reporter] Are they members of the, uh, Black Muslims?
I would not know that.
-[reporter] How do you feel now? -[man] I wanna kill somebody.
That's right, I wanna kill somebody.
Before the night's over, if Malcolm dies, somebody gonna die.
translation.ko: 밤이 오기 전에 맬컴이 죽으면 누군가가 죽을 거예요

translation.en: [Herb] He was our manhood.
He was the-- A milestone, you know, our anchor.
Malcolm X was the greatest Black man since Marcus Garvey.
translation.ko: 맬컴 엑스는 마커스 가비 이후 최고의 흑인이었어요

translation.en: And when you lost it, you found out
how really lost you were as a people.
translation.ko: 우리 민족이 얼마나 길을 잃었는지 깨닫게 됐어요

translation.en: [crowd singing] ♪ We shall overcome some day ♪
[reporter 1] Mr. Muhammad, yesterday in a wire story, uh,
a Muslim was quoted as saying, uh, that,
"The chickens had come home to roost on Malcolm,"
translation.ko: '맬컴의 죽음 역시 닭이 닭장으로 돌아온 것이다'

translation.en: in reference to Malcolm's earlier statement
translation.ko: 맬컴이 케네디 대통령의 암살을 두고 한 발언을

translation.en: about the assassination of President Kennedy.
Do you feel a Muslim brother would make such a statement about Malcolm
translation.ko: 무슬림 형제가 맬컴이 최근에 사망한 걸 알고

translation.en: upon learning of his death?
Well, I don't know.
I know nothing about who it was any more than you.
translation.ko: 저도 당신처럼 누가 그런 말을 했는지 몰라요

translation.en: [reporter 2] Has any police force, sir, asked you for a statement?
No, sir.
[reporter 1] Mr. Muhammad, Malcolm, before he was killed yesterday,
translation.ko: 무하마드 씨 맬컴이 어제 살해당하기 전에

translation.en: said the Black Muslims were trying to kill him.
translation.ko: 블랙 무슬림이 자신을 죽이려 한다고 했는데요

translation.en: Would you comment on that?
I know nothing about it.
We're not, uh, violent people.
This is a shock to us.
[documentary interviewer] What do you think happened to Malcolm X?
-What do I think? -[documentary interviewer] Yes.
What I know, what happened to him.
translation.ko: 내가 아는 건 맬컴한테 일어난 일뿐이에요

translation.en: I know he deviated and…
And he died.
[Zaheer] It's very easy to tell the story of the assassination of Malcolm X
translation.ko: 누구나 쉽게 맬컴 엑스 암살 사건을

translation.en: as a story of a dissident
who leaves a movement and is punished for that.
And certainly, there was definitely bad blood
between Malcolm and the Nation of Islam.
[Zaheer] But from what we have been able to glean from the released FBI files,
translation.ko: 우리는 정보를 수집해 봤어요 공개된 FBI 파일에서요

translation.en: and they have not all been released, is that the FBI was gleefully
translation.ko: 다 공개되진 않았죠 FBI가 분열의 싹을 보고

translation.en: watching this gap, this split grow,
and grow bitterly between Malcolm
and the Nation of Islam.
translation.ko: 점점 악화하는 걸 좋아했어요 "일라이자 무하마드와 맬컴 사이의 균열 악화"

translation.en: The hidden hand was the federal government.
They would never let a white man shoot Malcolm,
translation.ko: 백인이 맬컴을 쏘게 하지는 않았을 거예요

translation.en: 'cause that would have been… catastrophe.
Now, you always have, excuse my expression,
niggas who will sell out their mother for $2.
[reporter] Police are everywhere, on rooftops,
standing on fire escapes, in plain clothes,
translation.ko: 사복 차림으로 옥상이나 비상계단에 서 있죠

translation.en: and hundreds of New York City policemen in uniform along 147th Street.
translation.ko: 뉴욕시 경찰관 수백 명이 147번가를 따라 대기합니다

translation.en: So far, the last rites for Malcolm X
are being performed without incident.
[Ilyasah] My sisters and I lost our father…
…but I think for Black people,
that we lost someone who was brilliant,
kind, loving,
very compassionate.
I think that you have to be
in order to have such a profound reaction to injustice.
translation.ko: 불의에 그토록 격렬하게 반응했다면 그런 사람일 수밖에 없죠

translation.en: [Dr. West] James Baldwin wrote of Malcolm X,
translation.ko: 제임스 볼드윈은 맬컴 엑스에 관해 이렇게 적었어요

translation.en: "He was the most gentle and tender man I ever met."
That's not the image of Malcolm. But he saw Malcolm relating to Black folk.
translation.ko: 맬컴의 이미지는 아니죠 하지만 흑인들과 소통할 땐 그랬어요

translation.en: [Shabazz-Allah] He honored his own code that he taught us.
translation.ko: 자기만의 규칙을 지키고 우리한테 가르쳐 줬어요

translation.en: Accept death.
Once you accept death, you're free.
[reporter] The day before Malcolm X was to be buried,
Elijah Muhammad made his first public appearance since the assassination.
translation.ko: 일라이자 무하마드는 암살 이후 처음으로 모습을 드러냈습니다

translation.en: The Nation's leader was barely visible behind the human wedge of bodyguards.
If you would like to follow anyone against me,
go ahead and do it.
-[crowd clamors] -But your, uh-- That-- Your end will be pretty bad.
translation.ko: 하지만 여러분의 끝은 좋지 않을 겁니다

translation.en: -[crowd clamors] -I fear for you.
[reporter] Also in Chicago, participating in the Muslim convention,
is the heavyweight champion Cassius Clay.
His adopted Muslim name: Muhammad Ali.
[Muhammad] Malcolm X and anybody else who attacks
or talks about attacking Elijah Muhammad will die.
translation.ko: 일라이자 무하마드를 공격하겠다는 말만 해도 죽을 겁니다

translation.en: No man can oppose the Messenger of Almighty God, uh,
translation.ko: 그 누구도 말로나 육체적으로 신의 사자를 거역하고

translation.en: verbally or physically, and get away with it.
[Dr. Smith] Muhammad Ali becomes part of this chorus,
that anyone who crosses Elijah Muhammad must die.
translation.ko: 일라이자 무하마드의 심기를 거스르면 누구든 죽는다고 하죠

translation.en: That's the tragedy in all this.
That Malcolm is the enemy?
Was Malcolm the enemy when he brought his family to Miami?
translation.ko: 맬컴이 가족을 마이애미로 데려왔을 때 적이었나요?

translation.en: Did he think that Malcolm was the enemy when he prayed with him before his fight?
translation.ko: 경기 전에 맬컴과 기도했을 때 적이라고 생각했을까요?

translation.en: Malcolm X got famous
mainly being hard on people like you, white people.
translation.ko: 당신 같은 백인들한테 심한 말을 해서죠

translation.en: White devils, you blue-eyeded, blond-headed dog.
translation.ko: 하얀 악마 파란 눈동자에 금발 개자식

translation.en: Whites cared nothing about Malcolm nor so-called Negroes
when he was with the Honorable Elijah Muhammad,
translation.ko: 일라이자 무하마드와 함께일 땐 신경도 안 썼는데

translation.en: but they seem to love and follow our dead leaders,
translation.ko: 갑자기 우리의 죽은 지도자들을 사랑하고 따르는 것 같네요

translation.en: and now they have a dead man who was nothing but a--
And he admit himself, Malcolm,
was a tramp, a…
Had white women selling their body for him.
translation.ko: 맬컴 밑에서 백인 여자들이 몸을 팔았어요

translation.en: He was nothing until the Honorable Elijah Muhammad made him great.
translation.ko: 일라이자 무하마드가 세워 주기 전엔 아무것도 아니었죠

translation.en: And if Malcolm X had stayed with the man that made him great,
translation.ko: 맬컴 엑스가 자신을 세워 주고 모든 걸 가르쳐 준 사람과

translation.en: taught him everything he knew, today, he'd have been big, big, big.
[Maryum] In '72, my father went to Mecca.
And that is what got my father to true Islam.
Elijah Muhammad, leader of the Black Muslims,
died of heart failure today in Chicago.
He was 77 years old.
We left the Nation, I believe, around '75.
I was seven years old.
[Rahman] My brother was so good.
See, you gotta be me to understand how I feel.
I was the only brother. Only one brother.
[stammers] Blood brothers.
I miss him so much, but I'm going to see him in heaven.
translation.ko: 형이 너무 보고 싶지만 천국에서 만날 거예요

translation.en: Oh, I can't wait to see him. I will hug and kiss him.
translation.ko: 빨리 보고 싶어요 껴안고 입 맞출 거예요

translation.en: [documentary interviewer] Do you remember anything that Muhammad Ali regretted?
Let me think.
-Let me think a few minutes here. -[documentary interviewer] Yeah.
That's a hell of a-- Hell of a question.
[Herb] So many years are gonna go by,
and we're always curious about a generation or two from now,
translation.ko: 우린 미래 세대의 생각이 항상 궁금할 거예요

translation.en: and what perceptions are they gonna have,
what estimations will they have of Muhammad Ali,
of Malcolm X?
You know, what were the trajectories of their lives, and what did it mean?
translation.ko: 그들의 삶의 궤적에 어떤 의미가 있었을까요?

translation.en: Already we can see it being played out
in different literature, different films,
different venues.
[commentator] Look who gets it next.
[commentator] The greatest.
