[Dr. Boyd] The Ali that has been presented to the public
since 1996
is a false image.
They've managed to edit out
those things that made Muhammad Ali controversial in another era.
translation.ko: 다른 시대에 일으킨 논란들을 용케 덮었죠

translation.en: [Dr. West] The same people who gave him a standing ovation in Atlanta…
translation.ko: 애틀랜타에서 알리한테 기립 박수를 보낸 사람들이

translation.en: …the same people 20 years earlier
had talked about him like a dog.
[Dr. Boyd] He was a strident critic of white supremacy.
[Muhammad] And I just don't think I should go 10,000 miles from here
and shoot some Black people who never called me nigger,
translation.ko: 절 검둥이라고 부른 적도 없는 흑인들을 쏘겠어요?

translation.en: never lynched me, never put dogs on me, never raped my mama.
translation.ko: 절 공격하고 개를 풀고 제 어머니를 성폭행하지 않았죠

translation.en: And I think a lot of that got written out
because of his illness
and the fact that he wasn't really able to speak.
[Malcolm] And even today, America is still a country whose governmental system
is based upon freedom, justice and equality for white people only.
translation.ko: 백인만을 위한 자유와 정의와 평등을 기반으로 합니다

translation.en: There's no such thing as freedom in this country for a Black man.
Malcolm, of course, got killed in '65
and so people have been rewriting his narrative ever since.
translation.ko: 사람들이 그 이후로 맬컴의 이야기를 재기록했어요 "맬컴 엑스 대로"

translation.en: First time I went to the post office to buy Malcolm X stamps, I was conflicted.
translation.ko: 처음 맬컴 엑스 우표를 사러 우체국에 갈 때 갈등했어요

translation.en: When Malcolm was killed in 1965,
no one would've imagined that he would ever be
on any official product of the US government.
translation.ko: 미국 정부의 공식 제품 속에 등장할지 몰랐거든요

translation.en: Seeing Malcolm on a stamp is really symbolic
of how his image changed over time.
translation.ko: 하지만 맬컴 우표는 상징적이에요 맬컴의 이미지가 어떻게 변했는지 알 수 있죠

translation.en: [Herb] To a certain extent, he still lives with us.
He hasn't been taken away.
The spirit of him lives.
[Shabazz-Allah] You can kill a man, but you can't kill the idea.
translation.ko: 사람은 죽일 수 있지만 사상은 죽일 수 없어요

translation.en: Every junior high school, every college, every university, all over YouTube,
they playin' Malcolm's audios and videos just like he's still here.
And what he was teaching 50 years ago,
you see it happening today.
Black history, American history, and world history changed
translation.ko: 흑인 역사, 미국 역사 세계 역사가 바뀌었어요

translation.en: because of these two guys that had the nerve
translation.ko: 두 사람이 대담하게 자신을 드러낼 용기를

translation.en: to be themselves and be bold.
And that boldness became contagious.
…it's the two-legged dog that controls…
[Rev. Sharpton] They defined a whole generation
of where we walked with our heads held high
translation.ko: 어깨를 쫙 펴고 당당하게 고개를 들고

translation.en: and our shoulders back.
[Maryum] People forget my father was still this young man in his 20s
whose eyes was on a championship.
There are things that Malcolm taught him that my father kept with him
translation.ko: 맬컴이 가르쳐 준 것 중에 아버지가 죽는 날까지

translation.en: until his last day.
[documentary interviewer] How did your brother feel about Malcolm X
after he was assassinated?
Did he ever talk to you about regrets or how he felt?
translation.ko: 후회하거나 자신의 감정을 말해 준 적이 있나요?

translation.en: He never did, but I know my brother. He--
translation.ko: 말은 안 했지만 난 형을 잘 알아요

translation.en: He felt-- He felt bad.
It hurt my brother bad, yes.
[Ilyasah] Once he severed ties with the Nation of Islam,
translation.ko: 네이션 오브 이슬람과의 관계를 끊은 뒤에

translation.en: Muhammad Ali reached out to our family.
I think Muhammad Ali likely felt
that he owed it to my father
to make sure that his wife and his babies were safe
translation.ko: 아버지의 아내와 자식들이 안전하게 잘 지내는지

translation.en: and that they were okay.
[Attallah] There was a double take when I came upon him,
translation.ko: 무하마드 알리를 우연히 만나고 깜짝 놀랐어요

translation.en: somewhere between me turning 18, 19 or 20.
Now looking right into his face-- You know how he is.
You know, he gives you that little dare like, "Is that you?"
From the very moment we found one another,
it was as if no time had passed at all.
translation.ko: 시간이 전혀 흐르지 않은 것 같았죠

translation.en: We cried out loud.
His grief for having not spoken to my dad before he left.
translation.ko: 제 아버지가 떠나기 전에 소통을 단절해서 슬퍼하셨죠

translation.en: Having Muhammad Ali in my life somehow sustained my dad's breath for me
translation.ko: 무하마드 알리와 가까이 지내며 아버지의 숨결을 느꼈어요

translation.en: just a little while longer,
[voice breaking] 51 years longer.
Until now.
[Muhammad] I upset Sonny Liston, and I just turned 22 years old.
translation.ko: 난 소니 리스턴을 이겼고 막 22살이 됐어요

translation.en: I must be the greatest!
I am the king of the world!
[Malcolm] He's my brother and my friend.
I express what I know and understand around him,
translation.ko: 제가 알고 이해하는 걸 표현할 뿐이에요

translation.en: but he has a mind of his own, an understanding of his own.
[Ilyasah] It was destiny that they would feel that brotherhood
translation.ko: 두 사람이 형제애를 느끼고 함께 성장하는 건

translation.en: and learn together.
But there were these outside forces
that prevented them from continuing
this beautiful relationship that had started.
[Hana] We were writing my father's autobiography, The Soul of a Butterfly,
translation.ko: 아버지와 제가 2003년에 아버지의 자서전인 '나비의 영혼'을 쓸 때

translation.en: it was in 2003,
I asked him about Malcolm X
and how he felt about the relationship and how it ended.
translation.ko: 그 관계에 대한 감정과 관계의 끝에 관해서요

translation.en: And I remember,
my father sat back in his chair and he closed his eyes…
translation.ko: 아버지는 의자에 편히 앉아서 눈을 감으셨죠

translation.en: …and it took him a little bit to respond, maybe 10 or 15 seconds,
and he said to me--
He said that turning his back on Malcolm was one of his greatest regrets.
translation.ko: 맬컴에게 등을 돌린 게 가장 큰 후회라고 하셨어요

translation.en: He wished that he could go back and tell Malcolm that he was sorry,
that he loved him, that he was his friend,
and that he was right about so many things.
translation.ko: 맬컴의 말이 다 맞았다고 말하고 싶댔어요 "무하마드 알리의 모스크 펜실베이니아주 디어레이크"

translation.en: [Ilyasah] One of the things that I'll never forget was…
looking up at Muhammad Ali and asking him,
"Did you love my father?"
And him saying,
"I loved your father with all my heart."
